title: Chris Roberts admits selling counterfeit art, calls it a mistake: report
content: Jefferson Parish Councilman Chris Roberts has admitted selling a counterfeit print of a New Orleans artist's painting of Fats Domino, The New Orleans Advocate reports. He says it was an honest mistake, that he didn't realize the image was copyrighted and that he made only $11 on the sale. The $50 transaction took place May 12 at the Gretna Art Walk. When artist Becky Fos found out about it, from the buyer via her ex-husband, she reported it to the Police Department. Fos agreed not to press criminal charges against Roberts. He said he plans to donate some prints of photographs he has taken to a Fos event. Read The Advocate's full story. Artist Becky Fos is surrounded by some of her work hanging in the Magazine Street gallery in New Orleans on June 27, 2017. (Photo by Chris Granger, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune archive)Drew Broach  . . . . . . . contentWithMarkup: Jeff councilman says he didn't realize Fats Domino image was copyrighted
